channel.title: June Journal on FalconBlog
channel.description: Recent content in June Journal on FalconBlog

item.title: Day 30
item.description:
📅 June 30, 2025 – Monday

  • 📖 Studied Material Science for Electrical Engineers: Put in a solid 3+ hour session deeply focused on crystallography, semiconductors, and energy bands.
  • 📚 Borrowed Books from NIT Library: Picked up reference books for both Material Science and Engineering Electromagnetics to aid in exam preparation.
  • 🔌 More Electromagnetics Study: Dedicated additional 2+ hours reviewing concepts and solving problems related to transmission lines and waveguides.

Rounded off June with a focused academic push, ensuring both subjects are on track heading into the next phase.

item.title: Day 29
item.description:
📅 June 29, 2025 – Sunday

  • 📚 Studied Engineering Electromagnetics: Dedicated 2+ hours to revising key concepts. Focused particularly on Maxwell’s equations and wave propagation.
  • 🧠 Final Attempt at GCTF Challenges: Took one last shot at solving the remaining Google CTF questions. It was a mentally stimulating session.
  • 📝 Module Assignment Form: Created and circulated a Google Form to gather module preferences or updates from the team. It will help streamline project responsibilities moving forward.

A productive day of both academic and CTF-related progress, with a strong sense of closure as the month nears its end.

item.title: Day 28
item.description:
📅 June 28, 2025 – Saturday

  • 🎤 Project Pitch to Ramakrishna Math & Robotics Lab R&D: Presented our project idea and ongoing work to esteemed members of the R&D cell. The pitch went smoothly and received thoughtful feedback.
  • 🛠️ Stereo Setup Advancements: Continued working on the stereo setup. Spent time understanding the physical functioning of the stereo camera rig to enhance calibration accuracy.
  • 🧠 Started GCTF (Google CTF) Questions: Dived into GCTF challenges to brush up on cybersecurity fundamentals and problem-solving.
  • ✅ Task Assignments: Delegated upcoming responsibilities to project members for the next work cycle.

The day was filled with exciting interactions and learning. Progress on both the technical and planning fronts has been steady.

item.title: Day 27
item.description:
📅 June 27, 2025 – Friday

  • 📝 Drafted Meeting Agenda: Prepared a detailed agenda for the weekly project meeting to ensure structured discussions and progress tracking.
  • 👥 Held Project Meeting: Participated in the scheduled weekly team meeting. Discussed development milestones, upcoming deadlines, and stereo setup improvements.
  • 🔍 Refined Stereo Setup: Continued work on the stereo vision system. Generated another round of depth maps and observed inconsistencies that require calibration and tuning.
  • 📈 Evaluation: Depth map accuracy still not optimal — identifying areas where disparity and baseline adjustments are needed.

The meeting helped align the team, and tomorrow’s focus will be on hardware tweaks and deeper debugging of stereo output.

item.title: Day 26
item.description:
📅 June 26, 2025 – Thursday

  • 🧾 Drafted Project Tasks: Structured and documented the tasks for each project member for the upcoming week to ensure clarity and accountability.
  • 🛠️ Worked on Project Modules: Continued working on the assigned modules, focused on stability and testing edge cases.
  • 🤖 Stereo Setup Progress: Successfully set up the stereo camera system and obtained a preliminary depth map output.
  • 🧪 Experimental Analysis: Validated the quality of the generated depth data; began planning improvements to enhance mapping precision.

The stereo mapping pipeline is finally shaping up. Tomorrow’s goal is to fine-tune the accuracy and integrate it with navigation systems.

item.title: Day 25
item.description:
📅 June 25, 2025 – Wednesday

  • 🧠 Codeforces Practice (8:30–9:30 AM): Solved 3 problems from the problemset to sharpen competitive programming skills.
  • 🤖 Built FalconBot (9:30–10 AM): Created my first Telegram bot, a mini utility tool – FalconBot.
  • 🍽️ Breakfast (10:00–10:30 AM): Took a quick recharge break.
  • 🔐 Google CTF – Crypto (10:30–12:30 PM): Solved the Blinders challenge from Google CTF 2024 – a fun and tricky crypto problem.
  • 🔑 OpenAI Router & API Keys (12:30–1:30 PM): Experimented with routing requests and managing API keys for future automation tools.
  • 🤝 Project Collaboration (1:30–2:30 PM): Helped teammates with their tasks and contributed to active modules.
  • 🍛 Lunch (2:30–3:00 PM): Refueled with lunch.
  • 🎓 NPTEL Lectures (3:00–5:00 PM): Studied selected NPTEL content to enhance foundational understanding.
  • 🍪 Snack Break (5:00–5:30 PM): Quick refreshment.
  • 🏥 Hospital Visit & Shopping (5:30–6:30 PM): Took care of essentials and quick shopping.
  • 😌 Loafing (6:30–8:00 PM): Took time to relax and mentally recharge.
  • 📞 Project Meet (8:00–10:30 PM): Long call with project lead; reviewed progress, restructured plans, and reassigned roles.

A jam-packed day blending tech, productivity, and self-care.

item.title: Day 24
item.description:
📅 June 24, 2025 – Tuesday

  • Stereo Camera Setup: Worked hands-on with the stereo cam configuration for the startup project. Focused on tuning parameters and verifying setup stability.
  • Project Discussions: Had an in-depth discussion with the team lead regarding important updates and milestones. Planning for the next sprint began.
  • Competitive Programming: Spent time learning new CP tactics, reinforcing problem-solving techniques, and brushing up concepts.

One of those solid days of technical work, strategic planning, and personal growth.

item.title: Day 23
item.description:
📅 June 23, 2025 – Monday

  • Codeforces Contest: Participated in a Div 2 contest and successfully solved 2 questions. Almost cracked the third one—confidence is growing steadily.
  • Evening Sports: Took a break and played a good round of football, a much-needed physical refreshment.
  • C++ Practice: Continued my daily habit by spending another 2 hours diving deeper into C++ programming concepts.

Great balance between tech, exercise, and consistency today.

item.title: Day 22
item.description:
📅 June 22, 2025 – Sunday

  • Updated Profiles: Polished up my LinkedIn and GitHub profiles to reflect my latest work and activities.
  • Readme Revamp: Refreshed my GitHub README.md, making it more representative of my projects and contributions.
  • LaTeX Exploration: Spent time learning LaTeX, understanding the basics and experimenting with academic templates.
  • Academic Prep: Researched and gathered templates related to BTPs and UGRC to stay prepared for upcoming semesters.
  • C++ Practice: Dedicated 2 hours to improving C++ programming skills.

A well-rounded day spent organizing, learning, and prepping for future academic goals.

item.title: Day 21
item.description:
📅 June 21, 2025 – Saturday

  • Div 2 Codeforces Contest: Participated in a Division 2 contest and successfully solved 2 questions.
  • Major Milestone: Earned my first positive rating boost of +108, pushing me to a new peak rating of 926. Officially entered the “Newbie” category!
  • Small Celebrations: Took a moment to enjoy this long-awaited achievement. It’s a great confidence booster.

This day will be remembered as the day I finally broke into new territory on Codeforces! 🚀

item.title: Day 20
item.description:
📅 June 20, 2025 – Friday

  • Gazebo & Nav2 Experimentation: Continued working with Gazebo and the Nav2 stack. Ran several tests to improve my understanding of autonomous navigation setups.
  • Weekly Project Meeting: Had our scheduled weekly project meeting. Discussed progress and allocated upcoming tasks.
  • Chess Practice: Played a few more rounds of chess online and pushed my rating slightly higher to 918. Not bad for a week’s work!

Steady improvements both in robotics and recreational skills. Each step forward builds momentum for the next!

item.title: Day 19
item.description:
📅 June 19, 2025 – Thursday

  • Chess Practice & Rating Improvement: Continued with online chess practice and saw improvement, pushing my rating to 909.
  • Team Collaboration: Spent some time helping out teammates with their assigned tasks and planning.
  • Group Call with Friends: Had a fun and relaxing group video call session with close friends. Much-needed laughs and good vibes.

A light yet fulfilling day balancing personal growth and bonding time with friends. The momentum continues.

item.title: Day 18
item.description:
📅 June 18, 2025 – Wednesday

  • 1-to-1 Mentorship Session with Senior: Had an insightful discussion with a senior regarding academics and internship planning. Their inputs helped refine my direction and priorities.
  • Finalised Room Allocation for Next Year: Locked in the room allotment for the upcoming academic year at Cauvery Hostel — Room 2057. A small but satisfying milestone.

A day of clarity and closure on logistical matters. The right guidance always comes at the right time.

item.title: Day 17
item.description:
📅 June 17, 2025 – Tuesday

  • Tried Fixing a Stop Point in the Startup Work via Proxy: Attempted to resolve a critical issue in the startup project by experimenting with proxy setups. Unfortunately, it didn’t work, but the effort contributed to my understanding of network routing and limitations.
  • Div 3 Codeforces Contest: Participated in a Division 3 CP contest. Gave it my best and picked up several key fundaes.
  • Took CP Fundae from Senior: Had a discussion with a senior who shared invaluable tips and strategies to improve in competitive programming. Grateful for the mentorship.

Another day filled with learning through failure, contest participation, and mentorship.

item.title: Day 16
item.description:
📅 June 16, 2025 – Monday

  • Learnt More About Gazebo Fundamentals: Spent time understanding the deeper aspects of Gazebo simulation. Focused on model configurations, environment setups, and fine-tuning world files.
  • Practised Chess: Took some time off to sharpen my tactical thinking by solving puzzles and playing a few rapid games.

A balanced day of technical learning and personal improvement.

item.title: Day 15
item.description:
📅 June 15, 2025 – Sunday

  • Father’s Day Celebrations: Spent meaningful time with Dad, cherishing the bond and showing appreciation on this special day.
  • Played Sudoku Together: Enjoyed solving Sudoku puzzles with Dad – a fun, relaxing, and mentally engaging activity.
  • Helped Dad Dual Boot His Laptop: Assisted him in setting up a dual-boot configuration – a satisfying tech task done successfully.
  • Practised ECN: Dedicated time to Electrical Circuit Network (ECN) studies to keep my momentum going.

A day full of learning, bonding, and appreciation – perfect for Father’s Day.

item.title: Day 14
item.description:
📅 June 14, 2025 – Saturday

  • Outing to the Mall with Dad: Spent quality time shopping with my father, a refreshing break from the usual work routine.
  • Bought Track Pants: Picked up a pair of track pants, getting ready for the upcoming semester and workouts.

A light and pleasant day that helped reset my energy for the week ahead.

item.title: Day 13
item.description:
📅 June 13, 2025 – Friday

  • Second Project Team Meeting: Held a productive session with the team to track progress and plan upcoming goals.
  • Paper Review Conducted: Participated in an academic paper review session, enhancing my understanding of the topic and learning how to critically analyze technical literature.

item.title: Day 12
item.description:
📅 June 12, 2025 – Thursday

  • Second CP Contest: Participated in another competitive programming contest to sharpen my problem-solving skills.
  • Drafted Team Meeting Agenda: Outlined the key discussion points for the upcoming team meeting to ensure smooth communication.
  • Configured Notion for Team Collaboration: Set up and organized the team’s Notion workspace with project docs, task lists, and resource links for seamless coordination.

item.title: Day 11
item.description:
📅 June 11, 2025 – Wednesday

  • Team Meeting Recap: Conducted another team meeting to reinforce goals and track early progress.
  • Reviewed MoM_1 and Refined Templates: Revisited the previously drafted meeting notes and templates. Refined them for better clarity and usability.
  • Reassigned Tasks if Needed: Adjusted a few tasks based on feedback from team members for better workload distribution.
  • Documented Everything in GitHub: Maintained detailed logs and committed the updates to the project repository.

item.title: Day 10
item.description:
📅 June 10, 2025 – Tuesday

  • First Online Meeting with the Team: Held the first virtual sync-up. Discussed timelines, expectations, and assigned initial responsibilities to each member.
  • Drafted MoM_1 and Templates: Documented the Minutes of Meeting (MoM_1) and designed reusable templates for future meetings and logs.
  • Task Assignment: Delegated tasks based on everyone’s strengths and project requirements to ensure a productive week ahead.
  • Documented Everything in GitHub: Committed MoM_1 and templates to GitHub for team visibility and future reference.

item.title: Day 9
item.description:
📅 June 9, 2025 – Monday

  • Fun Intro Session with Team: Kicked off the project with a light-hearted and engaging introduction session. Helped everyone get comfortable and energized for the journey ahead.
  • Drafted Project Charter: Took the lead in drafting the official project charter to define scope, goals, and roles. A crucial step to align everyone on the same page.
  • Documented Everything in GitHub: Committed the project charter and related documentation to GitHub for transparency, version control, and team access.

item.title: Day 8
item.description:
🚀 June 8, 2025 – Sunday

  • Attended First Ever CP Contest: Participated in my first competitive programming contest. It was a thrilling experience that gave me insight into real-time problem-solving under pressure.
  • Documented the Experience on GitHub: Made a log of the contest, what I solved, and what I learned. This helps track progress and reflect on areas for improvement.
  • Project Tenure as Co-Lead Begins: Officially stepped into the role of project Co-Lead. Started organizing initial thoughts and planning out the first steps for the new responsibilities.

item.title: Day 7
item.description:
🛠️ June 7, 2025 – Saturday

  • Finalised Work at the Startup: Wrapped up remaining tasks and confirmed final deliverables. Marked the end of an exciting and educational phase.
  • Attended Co-Lead Interview: Gave my best in the project co-lead interview. Shared my past contributions and vision for future responsibilities.
  • Debugged TightVNC Issues: Faced connection problems with TightVNC. Managed to troubleshoot and resolve them successfully.
  • Documented Progress in GitHub: Pushed recent technical achievements and notes to GitHub to ensure everything stays tracked and organized.
  • Travelled Back Home: Made the journey back home smoothly. Used the time to reflect and plan next steps.

item.title: Day 6
item.description:
🧠 June 6, 2025 – Friday

  • Generated 2D Map Successfully: Continued progress on the mapping front. Achieved a consistent and accurate 2D map with improved detail.
  • Debugged Localization Issues: Faced challenges with robot localization but began troubleshooting systematically. Gained insights into possible TF and odometry conflicts.
  • Explored vSLAM Packages: Dedicated time to learning about visual SLAM systems. Compared different approaches and shortlisted ones that fit our setup.

item.title: Day 5
item.description:
🎮 June 5, 2025 – Thursday

  • Gaming with FS, ZDC, and HD24 Reunion: Reunited virtually with close friends for a fun gaming session. It was a nostalgic break and a great way to unwind.
  • Successful Map Generation and Optimization: Achieved a working 2D map after several iterations and calibrations. Optimized performance for better clarity and stability. Huge milestone!

item.title: Day 4
item.description:
🧠 June 4, 2025 – Wednesday

  • Had Technical Interview for Project: Faced the much-anticipated technical round today. Answered questions on project scope, tech stack, and individual contributions. Felt confident about my responses.
  • Mapping Test in Progress: Continued testing mapping workflows using simulation tools. Progressed with identifying errors and calibrating parameters for accurate outputs.

item.title: Day 3
item.description:
🧳 June 3, 2025 – Tuesday

  • Travelled to EV2 Office: Made the commute to the EV2 workspace to begin work on-site. Marked the start of a more hands-on phase in the project.
  • Met Rozen in Real Life: Finally got to meet Rozen in person after working remotely for a while. It was refreshing to connect face-to-face.
  • Started Working with Jetson: Began exploring and experimenting with the NVIDIA Jetson board. Initial setup and early tests gave a sense of the powerful possibilities ahead.

item.title: Day 2
item.description:
📘 June 2, 2025 – Monday

  • Shortlisted for Project Interview: Received confirmation for being shortlisted in a project-based selection. Felt encouraged and validated for recent efforts.
  • Read ECN: Dedicated time to read and understand topics from Engineering Circuit Network (ECN), continuing the academic prep and building subject confidence.

item.title: Day 1
item.description:
📘 June 1, 2025 – Sunday

  • Revised Basic C: Revisited foundational concepts in C programming, reinforcing core syntax and logic building.
  • Documented on GitHub: Created or updated repositories with the day’s learning and notes, maintaining consistent documentation habits.
  • Organised Mails: Spent time cleaning up and sorting email inboxes for better productivity and clarity going forward.
